item.title: PostgreSQL Isolation (not for all data types)
item.description: PostgreSQL Isolation (not for all data types) Running PostgreSQL We have used PostgreSQL’s docker image available here. The following command launches PostgreSQL and makes it available at localhost:5432 with username postgres, and password mysecretpassword. $ ./scripts/launch_postgres Sequences In PostgreSQL, sequences are objects used to generate sequences of integers. Sequences are created with the CREATE SEQUENCE statement. This creates and initializes a new single-row table called number_generator which can be observed with a simple SELECT query.
